purpose: Classify historical credit shocks by policy reaction outcome
methodology: Tag each credit shock as POLICY_RESCUED or POLICY_CONSTRAINED based on central bank response and market outcome

policy_response.fed_action: Corporate bond buying (Primary/Secondary Market Credit Facilities)

credit_shock_classification.mechanism: Fed backstop removed tail risk, spreads compressed rapidly
credit_shock_classification.lesson: In low-inflation regime, Fed has unlimited capacity to rescue credit

credit_shock_classification.mechanism: Markets knew Fed put was active, dip buying ensued
credit_shock_classification.lesson: Minor credit stress in dovish regime = buying opportunity

credit_shock_classification.mechanism: Crypto contagion allowed to propagate, no Fed put available
credit_shock_classification.lesson: In high-inflation regime, Fed cannot rescue credit stress

credit_shock_classification.mechanism: BOE intervention demonstrated central banks WILL act for systemic risk
credit_shock_classification.lesson: Financial stability concerns can override inflation mandate temporarily

credit_shock_classification.mechanism: FTX allowed to fail, contained contagion, inflation priority maintained
credit_shock_classification.lesson: Non-systemic credit stress in high-inflation regime = no rescue
credit_shock_classification.note: Positive return due to CPI print optimism, not Fed rescue

credit_shock_classification.mechanism: Fed created new facility within 72 hours, deposit flight halted
credit_shock_classification.lesson: Banking/systemic risk triggers intervention even with elevated inflation

policy_constrained_precedents.lesson: Initial non-intervention was policy error, massive rescue followed
Volcker could NOT rescue markets while fighting inflation
Fed tightening cycle = no rescue during adjustment

historical_comparison_set.regime_leakage_warning: The post-2008 'Fed Put' is a product of low-inflation, low-rate regime. DO NOT assume it applies universally.

ceio_assessment.anti_overfitting_note: Current assessment valid for Q4 2025 - Q1 2026 only. Regime can shift.
